t: Proverbs 2
The Value of Wisdom
My*pn son, if you receive my words and*ld treasure up my commandments with you,
making*ln your ear attentive to wisdom and*ld inclining your heart to understanding;
yes,*ln if you call out for insight and*ld raise your voice for understanding,
if*ln you seek it like silver and*ld search for it as for hidden treasures,
then*ln you will understand the fear of the Lord*s and*ld find the knowledge of God.
For*ln the Lord*s gives wisdom; from*ld his mouth come knowledge and understanding;
he*ln stores up sound wisdom for the upright; he*ld is a shield to those who walk in integrity,
guarding*ln the paths of justice and*ld watching over the way of his saints.
Then*ln you will understand righteousness and justice and*ld equity, every good path;
for*ln wisdom will come into your heart, and*ld knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;
discretion*ln will watch over you, understanding*ld will guard you,
delivering*ln you from the way of evil, from*ld men of perverted speech,
who*ln forsake the paths of uprightness to*ld walk in the ways of darkness,
who*ln rejoice in doing evil and*ld delight in the perverseness of evil,
men*ln whose paths are crooked, and*ld who are devious in their ways.
So*pn you will be delivered from the forbidden woman, from*ld the adulteress with her smooth words,
who*ln forsakes the companion of her youth and*ld forgets the covenant of her God;
for*ln her house sinks down to death, and*ld her paths to the departed;
none*ln who go to her come back, nor*ld do they regain the paths of life.
So*pn you will walk in the way of the good and*ld keep to the paths of the righteous.
For*ln the upright will inhabit the land, and*ld those with integrity will remain in it,
but*ln the wicked will be cut off from the land, and*ld the treacherous will be rooted out of it.
